title: Taliyah: Homecoming

embed.description: A rising threat in the desert forces a young stone mage to abandon her training and rush home to protect her family. Read the full story here: http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/featured/taliyah-short-story

body:
A video of Taliyah about to have a fateful meeting at Shurima! Check it out!

EDIT: For those wondering, Erica Lindbeck is the voice of Taliyah: https://twitter.com/ericalindbeck

replies.body:
From her perspective Shurima really looks like the lair of an evil tyrant god. Ironically Azir is pretty much the total opposite of that. 

Their meeting will be the most awkward thing in league history I guess <_<

> [{quoted}](name=Kyoki Shinkuro,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=HZyJXum9,comment-id=0009,timestamp=2016-05-02T17:40:53.307+0000)
>
> From her perspective Shurima really looks like the lair of an evil tyrant god. Ironically Azir is pretty much the total opposite of that. 
> 
> Their meeting will be the most awkward thing in league history I guess <_<

Yes, Yes and also Yes XD

I can't wait to see their in person interaction with each other.

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-popcorn}}

"I have come to slay an evil god."

{{champion:268}}  "BWAK?! AN EVIL GOD IN MY CITY!? BARRICADE EVERYTHING! SEEK SHELTER! I SHALL PROTECT OUR NATION FROM THIS THREAT!"

"Uhhh..."

{{champion:268}}  "Oh. You're talking about me..."

---

That's one of the scenarios I have in mind ^^

No one sees themselves as a villain. Azir sees himself as a ruler of people, bringing a great civilization and helping guide his subjects to greatness. Taliyah has heard of an evil tyrant who wishes to enslave his people for his own selfish desires, and it would have to be her to stop him.

Bottom line, both would see each other as a villain and themselves as a hero. Which is very good storytelling.
{{champion:86}} It's easy to know who the villain is. If they have an indicator above their head, then they are in need of being brought to JUSTICE.
Y'all motherfuckers need some justice.
http://images-cdn.moviepilot.com/images/c_scale,h_255,w_500/t_mp_quality_gif/lv5ejh0kcnosm2ply1w7/hero-villain-i-m-just-plain-handsome-not-the-hero-pandora-deserves-but-the-one-it-needs-413091.gif
And it's weird that when you think about it you can't tell if Jack was right or wrong.

I mean there's a lot of stuff out there breaking down if Jack is the hero. It all basically sums up to, "No".

The thing is that the vault hunters really aren't very "good" as protagonists go. The desire to bring order to a violent and dangerous world  is certainly purer motivation than the greed and wanderlust that brought the vault hunters together, so on a macro level it is pretty blurry. When you look more closely though, Jack is a really evil guy. He's narcissistic, sadistic, and is incredibly power hungry. It's pretty obvious that he's not even the "greater good at any cost" kind of guy because the only person he cares about benefitting is himself. His daughter is his only shot at redemption and the way he used her made it clear that even if he did love her she came second to his need for power.

Ah, when you put it like that, I see your point. Seems to me like it was just the lesser of the two evils. 
Also the obligatory

https://i.ytimg.com/vi/LEgY--RGclY/maxresdefault.jpg
I'm pretty sure {{champion:45}} considers himself a villian.

Even if he calls himself that, one can never be so sure. 

"Heroes are bound by a moralic and ethincal codex that limits their actions. Villains on the other hands can do EVERYTHING - including saving the world from unspeakable horror or destruction even if it would mean using absolutely unreasonable and terrifying means."

That could be his philosophy.

Well, if you look at Dr. von Doom in the Marvel Comics, that's something similiar. Doom has disregarded all possible moralic categories of good and evil to accomplish his goals. If his actions will make him a villain to some, he does not care, as long as he reaches his goal.

Veigar is like, the half-sized version of Doom...

http://youtu.be/5oBFncKVTh8

Spoilers: You just described the plot of Fable 3.

> [{quoted}](name=Kyoki Shinkuro,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=HZyJXum9,comment-id=0009,timestamp=2016-05-02T17:40:53.307+0000)
>
> From her perspective Shurima really looks like the lair of an evil tyrant god. Ironically Azir is pretty much the total opposite of that. 
> 
> Their meeting will be the most awkward thing in league history I guess <_<

Taliyah: Let my people go!
Azir: Churp? I did set all the slaves free.
Taliyah: Oh...well...this is akward.
(both look at each other for good 10 seconds)
Azir: So you want me to teach you Earthbending stuff?
Taliyah: DO I!
It'll be very hawkward indeed. You can be sure-ima about that.
I taliyah, it's gonna be good

Hopefully not "all" the stories are true. I'd be disappointed to see her at odds with Azir because that comment from the merchants about slaves was correct. Not to mention putting a notch in Azir's character.

I've said it once I'll say it again; opinions are painted by the available information. No one in Runeterra aside from Xerath and Azir lived to know Azir freed all of Shurima's slaves. Only Nasus and Sivir are likely to have met the now Ascended Azir. The world lacks knowledge pertaining to anything Azir's actually doing; they only have rumors to go on.

We'll see if Taliyah has a cool enough head to let reason prevail when she has that meeting with the emperor.

> [{quoted}](name=Sharjo,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=HZyJXum9,comment-id=00060000,timestamp=2016-05-02T17:28:40.173+0000)
>
> The world lacks knowledge pertaining to anything Azir's actually doing; they only have rumors to go on.

Yup. Taliyah doesn't know for sure if the city has truly returned, until she sees the sun disc for herself. But since that story was true, what does it say about the others she heard?
Can we expect a Shurima lore following? what happened with xerath, renekton and Cassiopeia? like I suppose they were around there when Azir resurrected and helped Sivir.
You can.
Will we finally see some Skarner lore =)?
I hope so; I wanna see how much more tragic they can make Skarner's history.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot ShadowStorm,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=HZyJXum9,comment-id=000600000000,timestamp=2016-05-02T18:07:11.916+0000)
>
> . But since that story was true, what does it say about the others she heard?

{{champion:12}} Yes, what they say is true. You can't milk those.
I'd be curious to know what those stories were. Seems like the city of shurima has a negative legacy? How did her people view nasus?

At the very least, there are the stories she heard from the merchants:

> “It’s a bit more common now that your people’s lost city has risen.”
>
> Taliyah looked up. “What?”
> 
> “Word has it the rivers flow backward too.” The merchant waved a hand in the air, poking fun at the mysteries of a far-off people he considered simple. “All because your bird-god has returned from the grave.”
> 
> “Whatever he is don’t make any difference. It all threatens trade.” The second merchant joined the first. “They say he aims to collect his people. Misses his slaves and all that.”
> 
> “Good thing you’re here and not there, girl,” the first merchant added.

But possibly other stories too, either as a child in Shurima, or on her travels. Not sure how much of ancient Shurima persisted in myth though. I'll bug Jaredan =).

Yasuo: _I'll follow this path until the end._
Taliyah: _I'll follow this path until the end._

https://fangirlingyoungadultreader.files.wordpress.com/2016/04/oh-no-you-didnt-gif.gif?noredirect

It's going to be freaking hilarious when she meets {{champion:268}}  ready for a fight, and he is all like, "Welcome home lost daughter of the sands, your family is safe, would you help me rebuild our empire and protect our people?"

The look on her face is going to be priceless.
I want that to be a comic of [Stupid Shurima Roommates](http://shurima-roommates.tumblr.com/).

**Taliyah:** I have come to put an end to your tyrannical reign!
**Azir:** Tyrannical? Let me ask you some questions.
_[Azir points to behind Taliyah.]_
**Azir:** What were the state of my people by chance? Were they fearful? Were they in chains? Were they being beaten by my guards?
**Taliyah:** Well I-
**Azir:** Did you notice anything like that as you came storming into Shurima?
**Taliyah:** Well no to each of your questions. but that doe-
**Azir:** I only seek to return the great city Shurima to its glory, minus the slavery.
_[Taliyah is very confused but her anger and determination has shrank.]_
**Azir:** If you want to truly help those you care about, you must help me stop Xerath.
**Taliyah:** How do you purpose I do that?
**Azir:** Well from the looks of how you got in here, you can manipulate stone. 
**Taliyah:** True.
[Azir weaves the nearby sand into an elaborate statue with very fine details. Taliyahs eyes widen with amazement.]
**Azir:** I can be your mentor and help broaden your talent.
_[Taliyah is filled with joy and yet still plagued by confusion]_
**Taliyah:** Could you give me a moment. This is a lot to take in.
**Azir:** Of course. Take all the time you need.
**Taliyah:** Thank you.
{{champion:101}} And you think I'm a comic book like villain who lets you assemble the _"Desert Avengers"_ before attacking you?
Sharjo. Lightning quick.
^ Azir vs Xerath showdown confirmed ;)

Why isn't she hot?

(incoming 100+ downvotes)
I thinks she's pretty, definitely not in the traditional sense but I like that she's not too typical.
She's also like, 16 years old. Most other female characters are probably in their 20s

Why does she have to be hot?

Obvious sexism issues aside, there are plenty of in-universe reasons, too. She's a poor child soldier gal, that fled and hide from both her former armies AND from Ionian militia with Yasuo, and made a desperate run towards her home country in what's probably a record time. Not exactly the best conditions to shine as a hot babe. I can bet she has no make-up, that she didn't bathe in over a month, and that the few clothes she has are well-worn with time and harsh travel conditions.

And last but not least, I def' agree with TheySeeMeWardin that even if she's not sexy "hot", she's still a pretty gal.

> [{quoted}](name=DeathBurs7,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=HZyJXum9,comment-id=00180003,timestamp=2016-05-03T15:03:23.687+0000)
>
> Why does she have to be hot?
> 
> Obvious sexism issues aside, there are plenty of in-universe reasons, too. She's a poor child soldier gal, that fled and hide from both her former armies AND from Ionian militia with Yasuo, and made a desperate run towards her home country in what's probably a record time. Not exactly the best conditions to shine as a hot babe. I can bet she has no make-up, that she didn't bathe in over a month, and that the few clothes she has are well-worn with time and harsh travel conditions.
> 
> And last but not least, I def' agree with TheySeeMeWardin that even if she's not sexy "hot", she's still a pretty gal.

Why the fudge not? It's been a long time since we had a beautiful female champion. Its not like she bends the rocks with her body, she weaves her staff so she doesn't have to be bulky and manly looking like illaoi.

> [{quoted}](name=ExecutorDill,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=HZyJXum9,comment-id=001800030000,timestamp=2016-05-03T15:29:50.350+0000)
>
> Why the fudge not? It's been a long time since we had a beautiful female champion.

I prefer my hot babes to have a reason to be hot. Look at other champs:

* Elise: succubus-like witch that seduce people to steal their life force and remain young
* Miss Fortune: bounty hunter that use her beauty to trick gullible men
* LeBlanc: mistress illusionist that can basically appear however she likes

They are "standard western mass media" beautiful, but it's logical. On the other hand, why the hell does Cait has a mini-skirt? She's a cop, for feck's sake, not a model. And Taliyah is a child soldier, she has far more pressing concerns than her appearance, like, you know, survive the war or evade her pursuers... Nobody would look hot in such conditions, not even MF.

Also, even if Taliyah doesn't exactly fit the "standard canon of beauty", she's not "hot" but she still has no obvious defect: she has a symmetrical face, she looks healthy and is not grossly over- or under-weight, she has no deformity. Maybe **you** don't find her attractive, but you can bet with 100% certainty that some people will be **genuinely** attracted to her, not just in a politically-correct-everyone-is-beautiful kind of way.

> [{quoted}](name=DeathBurs7,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=HZyJXum9,comment-id=0018000300000000,timestamp=2016-05-04T08:47:50.744+0000)
>
> I prefer my hot babes to have a reason to be hot. Look at other champs:
> 
> * Elise: succubus-like witch that seduce people to steal their life force and remain young
> * Miss Fortune: bounty hunter that use her beauty to trick gullible men
> * LeBlanc: mistress illusionist that can basically appear however she likes
> 
> They are "standard western mass media" beautiful, but it's logical. On the other hand, why the hell does Cait has a mini-skirt? She's a cop, for feck's sake, not a model. And Taliyah is a child soldier, she has far more pressing concerns than her appearance, like, you know, survive the war or evade her pursuers... Nobody would look hot in such conditions, not even MF.
> 
> Also, even if Taliyah doesn't exactly fit the "standard canon of beauty", she's not "hot" but she still has no obvious defect: she has a symmetrical face, she looks healthy and is not grossly over- or under-weight, she has no deformity. Maybe **you** don't find her attractive, but you can bet with 100% certainty that some people will be **genuinely** attracted to her, not just in a politically-correct-everyone-is-beautiful kind of way.

> [{quoted}](name=DeathBurs7,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=HZyJXum9,comment-id=0018000300000000,timestamp=2016-05-04T08:47:50.744+0000)

> 
> * Elise: succubus-like witch that seduce people to steal their life force and remain young
> * Miss Fortune: bounty hunter that use her beauty to trick gullible men
> * LeBlanc: mistress illusionist that can basically appear however she likes
> 
> They are "standard western mass media" beautiful, but it's logical. On the other hand, why the hell does Cait has a mini-skirt? She's a cop, for feck's sake, not a model. And Taliyah is a child soldier, she has far more pressing concerns than her appearance, like, you know, survive the war or evade her pursuers... Nobody would look hot in such conditions, not even MF.
> 
> Also, even if Taliyah doesn't exactly fit the "standard canon of beauty", she's not "hot" but she still has no obvious defect: she has a symmetrical face, she looks healthy and is not grossly over- or under-weight, she has no deformity. Maybe **you** don't find her attractive, but you can bet with 100% certainty that some people will be **genuinely** attracted to her, not just in a politically-correct-everyone-is-beautiful kind of way.

Lol her nose isn't symmetrical tho... She looks like Owen Eilson with that ish xD

Also you forgot Ahri bruh... And why do when have to be charming for a reason? You saying you only like women who look good when it benefits them in some form or fashion shows you have an interest in unfavourable "gold-digging" gals. What about riv? She's cute.... Tbh I actually liked her old splash more... She looked like this battle hardened tomboy kinda gal, now she just looks like lady gaga with one of her obscene outfits (that big ass shoulder plate tho).

> [{quoted}](name=ExecutorDill,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=HZyJXum9,comment-id=00180003000000000000,timestamp=2016-05-04T20:55:13.835+0000)
>
> Lol her nose isn't symmetrical tho... 

It is symmetrical, yes...


> Also you forgot Ahri bruh...

I did not forget her, I just gave a few examples. You know, there are 33 sexualized female champs in LoL (said Zenon on Twitter), I don't have time to talk about them all...

> You saying you only like women who look good when it benefits them in some form or fashion shows you have an interest in unfavourable "gold-digging" gals. 

What the what?! O_o You don't make any sense... I prefer women who look how it's logical and cohesive that they should look. A seductress should be hot. A cop should be formal. A soldier should be armored. I'm simplifying, but you get the idea, I hope. I don't "have an interest" for gold-digger, I'm just saying it's logical that a gold-digger looks hot.

> What about riv? 

Well I don't have much of a problem with Riven. I tend to agree that the old splash was better, but the new one is not bad. The poses in some splashes are kinda ridiculous imho (Dragonblade <_<) and I personally hate Battle Bunny, but it's just a skin, so whatever floats your boat... But her appearance in her base Skin is consistent with her lore and combat-style.

But tbh, I don't understand what was your point with Riven...

we'll eventually get an attractive female character again, like the traditional attractiveness, not this new age "everyone is beautiful"? Right guys?
I mean it's only been over two years since we've gotten the last attractive female character. Since our last one was arguably Jinx, (some wouldn't think shes attractive too skinny) or Quinn, back in 2013.
Since then we've gotten dead females (kalista), furry's (kindred), macho lady (tentacles) and a void monster (rek sai).

Hey if you don't find Kalista, Lamb, Illaoi or Rek'Sai sexy that's your problem bud. Your standards of beauty don't apply to everyone, so when you say "It's been over two years since we had any good looking female characters", someone else says "Lol are you blind?". 

> I mean it's only been over two years since we've gotten the last attractive female character. 

That's a statement that only means something to people who share the same views on what "attractive" is to them. Personally I'd rather we just get a wide variety of cool and interesting characters as opposed to just getting a load of wank material.

Not sure what problem people have with Illaoi. A strong woman who's rocking some impressive guns while also having quite a lovable and energetic personality to back it up. It's not like she's fat or looking unhealthy in any way, or has anything that would make her unattractive (like giant warts, scars, etc). 

I'd hook up with her, just saying. I doubt I would have a chance tho xD
I feel like she would be a little annoying always testing you... And ripping your spirit out of you body, that too

Whatever yall, I should have figured I'd get downvoted to hell, by all the SJW's. 

> [{quoted}](name=Sharjo,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=HZyJXum9,comment-id=002a0000,timestamp=2016-05-02T20:21:29.479+0000)

> That's a statement that only means something to people who share the same views on what "attractive" is to them. Personally I'd rather we just get a wide variety of cool and interesting characters as opposed to just getting a load of wank material.

Why can't a female champion be cool, interesting AND attractive, this is basically saying that for a female to be cool or interesting they have to be unattractive in a universal sense. 

Also yes attractiveness is subjective but there's still some rules of thumb on attractive vs unattractive, ie MF, Sona, LB, would all be considered attractive by the vast majority of people. 

So sorry I'm not a feminist and would like a SINGLE attractive female character (that isn't some niche) to be released since its been nearly 3 years.

> [{quoted}](name=TyRamos,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=HZyJXum9,comment-id=002a0001,timestamp=2016-05-02T20:43:55.001+0000)
>
> Whatever yall, I should have figured I'd get downvoted to hell, by all the SJW's. 
> 
> Why can't a female champion be cool, interesting AND attractive, this is basically saying that for a female to be cool or interesting they have to be unattractive in a universal sense. 
> 
> Also yes attractiveness is subjective but there's still some rules of thumb on attractive vs unattractive, ie MF, Sona, LB, would all be considered attractive by the vast majority of people. 
> 
> So sorry I'm not a feminist and would like a SINGLE attractive female character (that isn't some niche) to be released since its been nearly 3 years.

What you talking about, Taliyah is very attractive. Both visually and personality wise.

How are earth would you consider her "very attractive"? She has huge eyebrows, a gigantic nose, and a super unnaturally angled face. She looks closer to Rock Lee from Naruto than any female I've ever seen.

> [{quoted}](name=TyRamos,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=HZyJXum9,comment-id=002a000100000000,timestamp=2016-05-02T21:02:01.084+0000)
>
> How are earth would you consider her "very attractive"? She has huge eyebrows, a gigantic nose, and a super unnaturally angled face. She looks closer to Rock Lee from Naruto than any female I've ever seen.

Here, here shallow minded person. Let me tell you a story about beauty. Most people arent super models, most people have flaws. Most people look differently depending on where they live, what culture they belong to, and their biology. What you think is attractive is only one example that exists and is not the definitive "this is how all attractive people should look like" rules. 

She looks like a normal girl with middle eastern facial features. She also is kinda cute to begin with. So please dont exaggerate someones features (which arent that bad to begin with, in actuality she looks perfectly fine from where she comes from), you wouldnt like it as well if someone exaggerated yours (which can happen because different cultures and levels of tolerance, intelligence, and understanding).

http://mein-mmo.de/magazin/medien/2016/05/loL-Taliyah-980x500.png

> [{quoted}](name=Tesla Effect,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=HZyJXum9,comment-id=002a0001000000000000,timestamp=2016-05-02T21:09:49.413+0000)
>
> Most people arent super models, most people have flaws.

Not to mention that super models also have "flaws" and don't actually look like their magazine pictures. And ideas about what is generally considered "attractive" vary not only between cultures, but within the same culture from one generation to the next.
